Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add ECG test data infrastructure and synthetic data generator

Backend Test Data Setup:
- Backend/data/README.md: Comprehensive guide for ECG test data
  - Instructions to download real dataset from Zenodo (160MB)
  - Synthetic ECG generation for immediate testing
  - Dataset details and format specifications
  - API testing examples with curl and Python
  
- Backend/data/generate_test_ecg.py: Synthetic ECG generator
  - Creates realistic 12-lead ECG signals
  - Generates 3 test files: normal (72 BPM), bradycardia (50 BPM), tachycardia (110 BPM)
  - API-ready JSON format
  - No external dataset download required
  
- Backend/data/download_ecg_samples.py: Zenodo dataset downloader (optional)
  - Downloads full 160MB dataset from Zenodo
  - Extracts 10 sample ECGs for testing
  - Creates sample annotations
  
Updated .gitignore:
- Exclude large HDF5 files (already covered by *.hdf5)
- Exclude synthetic test JSON files
- Exclude temporary ECG data files

Rationale:
The full ECG dataset (160MB) exceeds GitHub''s 100MB file size limit, so it cannot
be committed directly. Instead, we provide:
1. Synthetic ECG generator for immediate testing (no download needed)
2. Manual download instructions for real dataset
3. Dummy data in Backend/dummy_data/ for Unity development

Developers can now:
- Generate test ECG data instantly: python Backend/data/generate_test_ecg.py
- Download real data manually: https://zenodo.org/record/3625006
- Use dummy data for Unity: Backend/dummy_data/*.json

All approaches support full backend API testing and development.

Add pre-trained ECG model to repository

Backend/model/model.hdf5:
- Pre-trained TensorFlow/Keras ECG classification model
- Size: 25.8 MB (under GitHub''s 100MB limit)
- Source: https://zenodo.org/record/4916206
- Paper: "Automatic diagnosis of the 12-lead ECG using a deep neural network"
  https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-020-15432-4

Model Details:
- Architecture: ResNet-based deep neural network
- Input: (batch_size, 4096, 12) - 12-lead ECG signals
- Output: (batch_size, 6) - 6 cardiac condition probabilities
- Conditions detected:
  1. 1st degree AV block
  2. Right bundle branch block (RBBB)
  3. Left bundle branch block (LBBB)
  4. Sinus bradycardia
  5. Atrial fibrillation
  6. Sinus tachycardia

- Added exception rule to allow Backend/model/model.hdf5
